column4: hey I need to remove a package from the repository the problem is its already removed and when I try to add a different package it gets stuck on the one it cannot remove?
<wweasel> sounds like we are in the same boat
lol I cant remove it and I cant leave it
What you could try is to make those directories.
That might work. You can use apt-get install --reinstall
Then you can try creating those directories with mkdir.
If you blank that script, then apt will think it uninstalled correctly.
Just change it to "#!/bin/sh", and that should work.
I must have the wrong location for the script.
You are still getting the same error message, or has the error changed?
Could you post the removal error message in #flood?
Oh! You're having a problem with the postrm script. So you need to blank the /var/lib/dpkg/info/brscan2.postrm
